definition: once/already/ever (in the past)/former/previously/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
"eight" component in Chinese characters/archaic variant of 八[ba1]
one of the characters used in kwukyel, an ancient Korean writing system
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
Sir Donald Tsang or Tsang Yam-Kuen (1944-)
just a while before/not so long ago/everyone can remember when..
déjà vu (the experience of seeing exactly the same situation a second time)/seemingly familiar/apparently already acquainted
Zeng Guofan (1811-1872), Qing dynasty politician and military man
did I ever ...? (or "did he ever ...?" etc)
lit. having crossed the vast ocean (idiom)/fig. widely experienced in the vicissitudes of life

sentences.english: I loved you tenderness and candor.
sentences.chinese: 我曾柔情似水满怀真挚地爱过你。

sentences.english: I worked with Viktor Frankl, a Nazi prison camp survivor, for many years.
sentences.chinese: 长期以来，我曾帮助过一位纳粹集中营幸存者。

sentences.english: Who would have thought a pansy could be such a naughty little flower.
sentences.chinese: 谁曾想到一三色堇可能是这样一个顽皮的花。

sentences.english: The papal captain have vainly endeavoured to induce his wife to remain behind him .
sentences.chinese: 教廷的队长曾白费力气地试图说服妻子留下不去。

sentences.english: I’ve been in that situation lately.
sentences.chinese: 我不久前也曾身陷这样的处境。

sentences.english: Wen Yiduo ever sang highly of Liu's creation.
sentences.chinese: 闻一多曾高度评价过他的诗歌创作。

sentences.english: Under the match of dark set, once one day inside sweep two records of counties.
sentences.chinese: 在暗组的配合下，曾有一天之内横扫两个县的记录。

sentences.english: Has the purple devoted to encourage and comfort can only temporarily soothe her injured heart.
sentences.chinese: 曾紫陌的鼓励和安慰也只能暂时稍稍安抚她受伤的心。

sentences.english: He was sure, he said diplomatically, that the government would do all it could.
sentences.chinese: 梁先生曾婉转表示，他确信政府已经尽力。

sentences.english: And hast borne, and hast patience, and for my name's sake hast laboured, and hast not fainted.
sentences.chinese: 你也能忍耐，曾为我的名劳苦，并不乏倦。

sentences.english: He says some people admitted they had killed their children.
sentences.chinese: 他说一些人承认他们曾杀过自己的孩子。

sentences.english: The National Weather Service had predicted that the river would crest to about 19 feet above flood stage.
sentences.chinese: 国家气象台曾预报红河将上涨到洪水位以上19英尺。

sentences.english: Women's Road Champion Sun Qingjing early Yuan was in this comprehension.
sentences.chinese: 元初女道冠孙清静曾在此修真。

sentences.english: They did it, I’ve done it, and so can you.
sentences.chinese: 他们做到了，我也曾尝试过，你也可以做到的。

sentences.english: I can't call to mind where I met you.
sentences.chinese: 我记不起来在哪里曾遇到过你。

sentences.english: Jefferson wrote, was the declaration of independence was "the referee" alliance.
sentences.chinese: 杰斐逊曾写道，《独立宣言》是“吁请世界的裁判”。

definition: once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
early or late/priority/in succession/one after another
he or him/(used for either sex when the sex is unknown or unimportant)/(used before sb's name for emphasis)/(used as a meaningless mock object)/other/another
in those days/then/in those years/during that time
to hold a governmental office or post/to assume office of/to take charge of/to serve as
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
